description: Size of smallest polyomino with surround number n (the surround number of a polyomino is the number of different ways that it can be surrounded by non-overlapping copies of the same polyomino).
references: W. F. Lunnon, Counting polyominoes, pp. 347-372 of A. O. L. Atkin and B. J. Birch, editors, Computers in Number Theory. Academic Press, NY, 1971.
example: a(2) = 5 because the smallest polyomino which has a surround number 2 is..X...XXX...X..
author: Brendan Owen (bdowen(AT)ee.mu.oz.au)
